reviews.review_msg: He doesn't really address the exam material in class. Just do the practice questions he posts as R exercises, and you'll do good.

THE GOAT!! If you have him, KEEP HIM! While his lectures are a bit boring & his voice is monotonous, the midterms and final exams were EZPZ. All the questions were from the exercises, but nothing drastic. It isn't code-heavy compared to other profs' HW. Just go on Zoom imo PLEASE TAKE BRAD FOR STAT 201! I got an F the 1st time with Rachel Altman.

Super chill class. 3 quizzes worth 20% and final worth 40% (worst quiz gets dropped if you do better on the final) the quizzes and final are pretty much the same as the exercises so definitely do those. he lets you make a cheat sheet for everything. would definitely recommend taking this class with him!!

If lectures don't make sense, read the textbook and make notes for each chapter (very helpful for making your cheatsheets). I would still recommend watching lectures b/c things that are not in the textbook are mentioned in class and can appear on exams. Very straightforward prof, so I would definitely recommend taking STAT 201 with Dr. McNeney.

lectures are pretty boring. 80% of class wouldn't show up for them since attendance wasn't mandatory. he speaks in a very monotonous voice, so it's rlly easy to fall asleep during lectures if ur tired. 3 quizzes worth 20% each, final worth 40%. problems on quiz/final pulled directly from the exercises on canvas so would 100% recommend u do them.
Grading is only based off quizzes and the final. Studying for this class is relatively easy as the tests have questions similar (if not the same) to the R exercises.
pretty chill prof, quizzes are straight forward, lets you create cheat sheets, majority of the questions are coming pretty much straight from the practice  questions he gives you
this guy bet me one grimace shake if i scored 90% on the stats201 final. glad to say that i enjoyed that grimace shake. happy birthday grimace.
we went to wendys and got a bag of jbcs. coolest prof ever
Quizzes are relatively straightforward and he allowed a cheat sheet. Make sure to do the exercises, as they are similar to questions you'll encounter on the quizzes/final.
Because of Brad, I was able to time travel and order the Travvy Patty from McDonald's. Shoutout Brad

I was eating at McDonalds when all of a sudden Brad pulled up with R exercises. He demanded my food because he was so hungry after teaching. I was confused because I saw him eating during the entire lecture. I haven't eaten in weeks!!
mmmmmm brad
Really easy teacher

Do his practice homework and you will finish in the class with an A, his exams are almost the same as his practice assignments. He's a really caring and nice prof and answers a lot of questions when you ask. If yall have him, take this course , trust

Prof was very nice and made mid terms and finals really easy cause they were exactly like the homework. Lectures really confused me and I had a hard time understanding the topics through his explanations. Most of my learning was done through YouTube videos. If you do the homework and understand it the course will he easy for you.
recorded all lectures, slides are a little confusing sometimes, but exams were very straightforward, he uses homework questions on exams since he does not release answer keys
Stats with this guy was so easy. As long as you do know how to do the homework and do the practice exams you're good to go. Not hard to get an A.

The class is really boring (what do you expect it's stats). That being said Brad tries his best to make the material interesting but it doesn't help that his voice is somewhat monotone. His exams are REALLY easy as long as you do his practice exams provided. Also allowed a cheat sheet in the midterm and final :)

I thought he was a fair prof. The lecture material is boring and he tried cracking jokes to make it interesting. The assignments are in groups and you are allowed a cheat cheat for the final and midterm. He tells you what to expect; his exams are easy!! I definitely recommend him as a prof

I found Brad to be a really good professor. Although the lecture material is very dry, he tells you what will be on the exam and what you don't need to know. midterm was  easy, average was 82. He's also very helpful and nice when it comes to not understanding something. Lecture notes are also very clear and concise.

he sounds like he's bored, but maybe because it's the summer semester. but he's a good prof and he's SUPER DUPER EASY! (maybe because it's the summer semester?) midterm was sooo easy, just wish i had studied more to get a great mark. read his notes and you'll do absolutely fine. good attitude to students and funny sometimes :P

Not an easy class, although it should have been.  Maybe it was the fact it was incredibily boring or that his notes really didn't help.  Wish I had learned more.  Assignments were easy but were a lot diff than the tests.  Makes a good attempt with a boring subject but overall I do not think he is a good prof.  Good luck staying awake.
No Comments

Very poor lectures. I wanted to learn more than I did from this course. Very disappointing. Not challenging at all, unless you have a problem with calculating means... He should have taught the chi square test because it is common in biological research.
really easy..there's no excuse for not doing well in his class..
Super easy, take it as a GPA booster
Nice teacher whose assignments are very fair. There is potential for the course material to be interesting, but his lectures are dry.
boring lectures but very helpful and nice.
Doing his best with an incredibly boring and easy course.  He helps people a lot on the Caucus site.  Seems like a nice guy, but needs more personality.
Horrible class. Lecture is heavy on material and he does nothing to help. You basically pay them to then learn all of the material all by yourself.

lecture videos are from COVID time. he spends so much of them rambling and complaining about his own slides. you finish the video and are even more confused. the textbook is your best friend. the exams are so weirdly worded. even if you know the material, the questions will make no sense. homework is the only easy thing.

P2
The fact that there's a part 2 is insane. This teacher does not care at all about your grade. He will dump work and let the TA do everything so he can sip a margarita and watch football. Idk if it's cuz he's close to retiring but his lack of care is gonna tank your GPA. Your main ally is the textbook, however, he also wrote it so gg have fun.

P1
You know some people apply to jobs and just copy and paste the same applications to 10 jobs. So you could be reading applications about someone looking to be a Starbucks barista while you're hiring for a warehouse worker. This is a summarization of Tim. He could care less about teaching he made lecture videos 7 years ago that are out dated.

A completely automatic class with him only sending a long lecture video. He sent out short summary video of the topic to students and it is definitely worth watching this instead of the long lecture video. Make good use of the questions in the online textbook and having a good TA is the key to survive in this course.
Completely automated class do not take it with him if you dont have to, doesnt have office hours and writes awful exams, doesnt let you see your mark or where you went wrong

Tim has the most boring lectures, the midterms are worth 15% each where you get 15 MCQs that are worth 1% of your grade each. He wont release the questions because he's lazy and wants to reuse them for the finals so you cant even see where you went wrong and try to learn from it. Worst prof i've ever had. do not take

the content isn't too difficult, its the way he tests his students on it. He barely teaches anything on the lectures he uploads and the zoom sessions but his exam questions are so complex and you have little time to work on it. The practice problems and homeworks also do not reflect the type of difficulty the questions on the exams have. avoid prof

The content is actually not hard, but he makes it way more difficult than needed. He aims to have an avg. of 50% for each midterm, so don't be surprised if you fall on the lower end of that spectrum. Especially because his lecture videos are 10 mins long and he just talks about his Tshirt... Take him if you have absolutely no other option.

Feels like a robot presenting the material in his live and recorded lectures. His talking style is very dry, he seems tired and not in the mood to teach the majority of the time, and overall an unhelpful professor.

do NOT take distance ed with him! there are no lecture slides/videos. you will basically be teaching yourself the entire course. he will never provide feedback. its like hes not even the teacher, the TA handles everything. tests are unfair, so much harder than assignments. biggest regret was taking this course!

The WORST prof I have ever had. Not only was he the most unclear prof ever, he was so disorganized and just made it seem like he had no idea himself what was going on. His notes, the worst. His lectures, the worst. No one ever even came to lecture because when you did, it was just confusing and he would just mumble and make mistakes. DONT RECOMMEND

shouldn't be teaching at all, heavy accents is not a problem but he can never finish one complete sentence, unclear at any time for anything- lectures, slides, solving questions during lecture, he can get confused by himself, delayed responding emails, unclear criteria. He was correcting final exams when there were 15 minutes left for the final.
He ran in late a pulled out a crumpled piece of paper to write notes on. He wrote the exam the night before and it was super unclear and had mistakes. DO NOT RECCOMEND.
Other comments says it all. Adding one point: his notes are the most unorganized I've ever seen.

This prof doesn't do a good job; He avoids relevance in class and is very slow with going through course material. He has an accent few understand, which is especially challenging in a department that has a lot of challenging grammar. He forgot to mark my exam <2 days before the final and ended up giving me 15%, So feel free to get an audit.
Do not take his course he is horrible. Very unorganized and honestly quite rude. Truly my least favourite course I've ever taken.

Dr.Lim was very inspiring.he was really interested in what he taught and tried hard 2 make u interested 2.i'd heard stat to be a boring class but Dr.Lim's class was so much fun.i looked forward 2 attending his class everyday.he's AWSOME.and HOT 2 ;)

The BEST prof I have had all semester. He truly cares about his students and spends the time to really teach you, even through email. He would write out paragraphs and encourages questions. Tests are FAIR and easy if you study. He should teach ALL STAT courses.

I'm glad to have Mr. Lim as my professor while I am still new to SFU. He wants everyone to learn well. He is really helpful and he replies emails even during weekends. He shares his experience to the class and really opens up my mind. He taught me a lot more than knowledge. Thank you very much! Best wishes in his future job.

He shares his experience to the class and really opens up my mind. He taught me a lot more than knowledge. Thank you very much! Best wishes in his future job.

Professor Lim definitely has all the essentials for being a honorable teacher. If anyone disagree him as the best, im sure that you can never find any prof who is better! Thanks professor, you ROCK!! And good luck to your future endeavor! PS. You are HOT!!
HAHA! he is the most awesome prof out there! really helps the class understand stats and having a good laugh while doing it. he is the man!

Great professor, I wish he was teaching STAT 302 so I could take it with him.  He really made me realize the power of statistics.  Really funny, great guy, always listened to my complaints and changed my marks.  Simply put, Yew-Wei is a stud.

I am glad I had him as a STAT professor. He was always available for help, answered emails evenings and weekends, and really put in the extra effort to make sure EVERY student passed his course. Pretty hot too.
funny
Great prof who makes learning stats interesting! Too bad he's not teaching at SFU anymore..

BEST SFU PROF THUS FAR!! Has a great sense of humor, cares a great deal about his student, wants everyone to do well. Makes a dull subject easy to understand. I have never met a prof so focussed and hard working than him. I wish him the best of luck in his future work (last term teaching). Thank you, u've taught me a lot more than just statistics!
Great prof who really made statistics interesting! Professor Lim, if you're reading this, I wish you the best of luck in your future endeavours.Thank you!

I wish Prof. Lim the best of luck in his future work. He is a amazing professor who cares about his students. More than that, his presence reminds me why we go to university in the first place: to learn and to gain a better understanding of our world and the people around us. Too bad he is no longer teaching at SFU!

he is an excellent prof. his notes are very good. he also follows the textbook closely.he's available for help. we haven't had the midterm yet so im not sure about his midterms and marking. a very nice guy in general. and he is verrrrry hot... i mean he is HHHot! and im not even a girl!
Passionate professor. Very friendly and helpful as other have already mentioned. Keen on students understanding material. One of my favourite professors at SFU thus far!
Great teacher, very clear, well organized, and very funny!
He wanted HOTNESS points. Here you go. A chill cat.
Definitely one of the nicest teachers at SFU. You can tell that he is actually passionate about the course. Very clear, precise, and helpful.
Favourite prof by far!!
Professor Lim completes my life.
Best professor in SFU ever! Louis Ng is the ultimate choice for STAT 100!
Great professor! Definitely deserve a 4.0 in rate my professor!
Worst prof that you can ever see in your life.
Toughest grader i have ever occured, she just want the exact answer shes expected, be careful
Very caring proff however she is not very good at teaching which maybe due to the fact its her first time teaching the course . She is a tough marker so be prepared.
Epic dude
great guy

literally the worst three hours of my week are spent trying to not fall asleep during this class. he slurs his words and talks so damn slow it gives me an aneurysm. he mixes up definitions on notes (that he doesn't post until he's reminded) and didn't even provide any type of course outline until asked. DONT MAKE THE SAME MISTAKE I DID
Can't understand anything he says! He faces away from the class to read and mumbles. Do yourselves a favour and take it with another professor... dropped after the first week.

Truly the most low-energy, boring speaker I have ever heard. I don't usually have difficulty paying attention, but this guy slurs his words and speaks so slowly that trying to understand him is torturous. No exaggeration, 21 people left the lecture during the second class. If you have the chance, take this course with someone else.

I need this course for my major but the prof was just so incomprehensible that I decided to drop and wait for a better instructor. I know that he's good at the subject but he isn't able to direct the material to the students that well. The stats department really needs to see this problem with Giles. I don't understand how he was placed as a prof.
no introduction whatsoever on the first day of class to any of the topics that the notes will cover. He's also hard to understand when he is talking
Worst class i've ever taken in my life, I dropped out first day.... He's so boring.
Jack is great! he is clear and fair. Really recommend taking Stats with him.

Best prof hands down. Stats can easily be boring and dry but his teaching method makes the course interesting and clear. Good amount of assignments as the exams are almost identical. Would take his class again.
Amazing prof.

Jack was a great prof! Lectures were always insightful, didn't open the textbook once, all you need are the slides. Exams were fair, make sure to use his office hours to your advantage as he was always happy to help. Assignments were rather long and some of the wording was difficult to understand so make sure to clarify!

On a personal level, Jack seems like a great guy who's got a good sense of humor. However, on a professional level he's mediocre at best. Perhaps this was due to it being a summer term but he was continuously late with posting lectures notes and difficult to reach - even leaving for vacation before finals. However, the course itself was not hard.
Jack makes lectures enjoyable but are confusing at times.  His exams are very fair and he does review sessions before them which are helpful.  The class average was B+.  He's a great guy!

Funny, young prof who is in with pop culture and makes a lot of jokes during lectures. Super chill, listens to his students, and has his eyes open for questions people have in class. Takes his time to explain concepts and makes sure everyone is on the same page. Would definitely want him as my upper division stats prof, without a doubt!
Jack was great!  Classes were fun and engaging and I would gladly take another class with him.

jack davis is a blessing.  he caters the course for the students and understands our concerns. even though the material isn't too interesting, jack is a very engaging and comedic lecturer, which made me wanna go to class. his final was very simple if you did the practice exams he provided and was very approachable. one of my fav profs for sure.

She cares about students, and is a very nice person but she CANNOT TEACH. She would often make mistakes in lecture and send 10 emails throughout the week correcting herself. Assignments were worth very little towards the grade, but they were a lot of work. Overall, a nice person but I would not take this class with her!

Talked to her on the first day of class, and seemed nice. I found it very hard to keep this respect for her as the term went on. 


EXTREMELY DISORGANIZED!!! 

crazy short deadlines and her assignments are super messy and redundant

also refuses to post anything on canvas, so you need to basically create your own calender for this class

I found her lectures quite easy to understand - you just have to read the assigned text before class. Only issue was that she gave a crap ton of homework that required knowledge of R (which is not included on exams), but the exams were fair and we were allowed to bring in notes.
Marie is awesome! Assignments can be more work than they are worth, but tests are fair and she is thorough in her lectures.
she's decent

I heard bad things about her prior to this class. She was actually pretty good. Explained the concepts pretty clearly, the assignments helped with the midterm. She gives a free 1% Iclicker, drops your lowest assignment score and provided online quizzes that weren't for marks. All in all not to difficult and a pretty decent professor.

She's a caring person and helps you outside of class. BUT shes a horrible professor. Her lectures are all over the place with technical difficulties every 10 minutes, mistakes in her notes and in assignment questions . Posts assignments last minute with 5-7 questions that she's barely touched over in class every week. Midterms were alright tho

Nice prof but she didn't teach very well. She didn't explain things clearly and she doesn't post notes beforehand so its hard to take notes when she's rushing through slides half explaining things. I hated using R as well. But the way she teaches is more concept based so if you're bad with numbers you should be fine.

her class is alright, bonus mark for all midterms and final, and makes her exams fine. Class average was almost 70% for all the midterms. The only problem is the short time frame to do the midterm and assignment on jupyter was annoying to do using R The prof is always available after lectures to answer any questions, and tries pretty hard explain

Extremely caring as a person, but not a great professor. Made exams relatively easy but tbh I would rather write harder exams with a prof who can convey the information better. Homework takes way too much time and her notes can be messy when she adds too much stuff with her ipad stylus

Made topics more complicated than they needed to be with terrible lecture slides. Homework was tedious and took way too long for something that doesnt adequately prepare you for exams. (She even says in the syllabus assignments take 6-10 hours) More than half the time spent on homework was due to coding which she doesnt test you on.

This was a frustrating course to take. She would whip through her lecture slides, skipping over important material very quickly. Her assignments required using code, which doesn't help us to practice for the tests at all... The assignments only really helped for interpretation, but no practice for using the formulas themselves. PICKY marker

she made it so much harder to do well than this class than should be. There was 172 of us in the class, she only gave 3 A+ because you needed a 95% as your final grade for an A+. The homework takes forever and is marked very specifically, so you will likely lose 5% off homework alone. Lost stupid marks on the final, she shouldnt teach

Gives several hours worth of homework every week as if that's the only class students are taking. Lectures are filled with mistakes and have to explain to her why those mistakes are wrong. Lectures are incredibly unorganized and hard to follow. Tests are too long, filled with irrelevant questions, and not marked fairly.

The worst prof ive had in university so far. Everything she says in lecture is wrong. She literally has atleast 20 mistakes in all her lecture slides. Asked her a question in lecture in class and she goes "oh ask me that after class". clearly shows low level of competency. Easy A but the prof makes it hard.
Just one comment. Gazillion number of mistakes on slides and everywhere else! Very confusing and frustrating! Wouldnt recommend her..
While she was't always certain of what she wanted to say and got confused during lectures the material itself was easy. I skipped 2 months of lectures and pulled off a B+ with minimal effort.

Marie Loughin is not a natural educator. She does not explain material very well, and there are several mistakes on her slides that add confusion. Read the textbook and do practice problems.  Assignments are long, but can prepare you for exams if you understand the concepts behind the problems.  Exams are very easy if you understand the concepts.

Her lectures begin with a simple example from the textbook, which could easily be done on your own. Then she goes on to say that "I don't go over everything, so go read the chapter," yeah wtf right?But you HAVE TO show up, since she adds EXTRA material for the test. Average homework assignments are about 3000-4000 words. TAKE IT ONLINE!

Reads directly off slides. Confused by her own notes. Has way too many technical difficulties. Constantly annoyed. Assigns way too much homework in way too short of time. Midterms do not cover anything done in the homework. Way too disorganized. Would not take a class with her again. AVOID AT ALL COSTS. You're welcome.

Her motto is "learn by doing", so she assigns so much homework. Homework doesn't prepare you for exams. She makes errors in her lecture notes and confuses herself and the class. Seems very annoyed when students approach her for questions. It's almost like distance education because she teaches so poorly, but with extra material she throws in
Great prof! His lectures were really clear and the notes were easy to understand. The midterms were the perfect difficulty. Not too hard. Assignments are easy.

He is worth every cent I paid Sfu for this course and I can't say that about many profs. He's a very engaging lecturer and knows how to test students on the material. I would recommend taking any class with him for a positive learning experience :) you won't regret it

Derek is a great professor and clearly cares about his students. He's always willing to answer questions and always repeats himself on important topics in lecture, to make things clear. Exam questions come directly from his assignments.
Extremely helpful prof, notes are straightforward, exams are fair and usually on the easy side, and he's always in a good mood.
would highly recommend...funny guy, made stats interesting and bearable =)...assignments were ok and midterms and final were similar to the practice exams

Statistics is one of theose subjects which many people just HAVE TO DO, meaning that the interest level isn't there for many. I promise you; before taking his class I thought I would HATE statistics, but the way that he does his lectures makes statistics enjoyable! Assignments and exams are fair.

A great prof.  His lectures were easy to understand, and his notes were well-organized.  Lectures were entertaining because he had a lot of jokes to tell.  The exams and assignments were fair as well.

Who knew that you could laugh so much in a statistics lecture?? Derek made this class interesting AND funny, a rare combination. His notes were good, although you HAD to attend class to write in half of them ;) His midterm was awful, but he realized that and made the final much better. Try to take stats with him!!

Worst prof I have ever had. I tried really hard to like her as she sometimes appears to care about our learning, but you soon realize that she really doesn't. The worst exam I have ever written was with her as it was so disorganized. We were adding, editing, and deleting questions during a 50 min exam. If you can teach yourself you will be okay.

I would say I have more of a stats background then most of the people who take this course which was the only reason I passed (many of my friends did not). Prof does not care about your learning. Slides were terrible, I almost completely relied on the textbook which was not enough to do well on the exams.

Theres three midterms, just did one for which the content was EASY, except we had 50 minutes and 25 questions, so 2 minutes per question. Class average for this was 13/22 and she said that it was good. Ridiculous to take a class who's content is easy and make it nearly impossible to do by not giving students enough time - just give us the class.

*not for stat 201, but 305 - she is the sweetest, nicest, kindest and most passionate stat prof, however she is terrible at explaining concepts and you have to teach urself for the whole course. 3 midterms, started off super easy then got progressively worse and the exams are entirely written w no mc. hw is all r code that u have to teach urself

Do not attend to class but read the text and her notes. She is very nice, but has strong accent, so is hard to understand. just do your homework. Exam will be exactly or very similar to H.W. and practise questions.
Good prof, his lectures are informative and clear. His exams are ok but his assignments take a long time.
Chill professor that makes what might be the driest subject matter even somewhat palatable. Plenty of time was given for the assignments and the tests allowed for the use of TYPED cheat sheets.

Everyone scared me and said STAT 201 is the hardest class in their degree, however Harsha made it one of the easiest! He would make you do all the hard calculations in the assignments that weren't worth much, and the exams which were worth more would have the most basic easiest questions ever. I studied two hours before the final and got full marks

Harsha was great for STAT 201!! His pre-recorded lectures were straight to the point and he even acknowledged on our first day of class that he would try to be concise as he understands that it's a boring subject for many and did not want them to drag. Exams are easy if you do the homework. R code can be tricky but he didn't put it on the exams.

Professor Perera was a really fair and understanding professor, and adapted very well with the online format. His lectures are very straight forward and include examples, there's about 5-6 assignments (he gives you more than enough time). Do the assignments, watch the lectures, read the textbook, and you should do fine. def take this class w/ him!

Lectures were easy to follow and mostly short. There were a few short quizzes during the semester, and a couple assignments. Assignments could be a little long at times, but similar examples were in the textbook that you could follow along. Exams were multiple choice and open book.

THE BEST PROF DO NOT HESITATE TO TAKE WITH HIM hands down the best prof, he has tons of office hours, he understands peoples situations, adjusts classes to the people that take them unlike some other profs out there. You will not regret taking a class with him, its an easy class in general but having an understanding, well teaching prof is perfect

Harsha is a really really solid prof for STAT 201. He's very organized with all the course material and is one of the most accommodating profs I've had. His lectures are all pre-recorded and he goes through them with a lot of detail (good pacing too). If you put in the work, it's not hard to get an A.
Harsha is a fantastic prof. Gives you the information needed without wasting time. Super clear criteria, easily accessible, very warm personality.

Clear, short lectures that are to the point. Exam quizzes and assignment are all base on thing he gave and assignment basically set you up to ace exams if you put in a few hours every 2 weeks. Extremely understanding and considerate during pandemic and course overall was taught well
Really solid prof for stat 201. Lectures were explained clearly and assignments reflected the exams. Course was not hard if you put time in to study. Perera is a really nice dude.

Honestly by far the most accommodating & considerate prof I've had during the pandemic. Really respectful and kind to students, Harsha genuinely tried his best to accommodate individual needs/difficulties that arose because of COVID. Lecture material is explained clear enough, difficulty is as you'd except of a stats course. Really great guy.
Wouldn't extend an assignment deadline for me and wasn't accommodating during exams the week following the death of two loved family members. Pretty heartless in my opinion.
I handed in an assignment late because I had a family emergency and he told me I get a zero anyways. Idk kind of heartless if you ask me.
his recorded lectures were terrible. The squeaking from his dry erase marker made it 10x worse to watch. It came to a point where i just relied on the textbook only, goodluck

It is unconscionable and unfair to students that this online class, which is entirely reliant on TA's for any engagement or teaching, is going ahead with a midterm in spite of the TA strike. Brief prerecorded videos are of little to no help in teaching how to solve problems which make up the body of the course content.

Your main source of communication are your TAs, but with them going on strike it became very hard to get help. Tim Is an intelligent man, but he clearly lacks the ability to convey that knowledge onto his students in any meaningful manner. Literally I have nothing else to say. Dr. Swartz is by far the worst professor I've ever had. Textbook bad prof. Time to retire Tim. He's a 15+ year, and its getting to his head. This class was awful! His online lectures are unhelpful so you're left to teach yourself with the textbook. The hardest class I've ever taking thus far. He has optional lecture videos that are confusing and barely relate to the content. not recommend this prof. He is cool himself but teach bad and his exams are not fair. even by studying hard you can't get a desirable mark.

Tim radiates apathy. While I went into the course fully expecting to do a lot of independent study, I didn't expect his lectures to be so uninformative, low-effort, and pointless. STAY CLEAR! The exams are made for failure, not like practice or textbook questions. Tim has got to be one of the worst professors at SFU. His lectures aren't good, basically a self-taught course. His practice questions are nothing like his exams. Tim is the worst professor at SFU. He's so out of touch with reality that I'm unsure how he still has a job. Everything in this course is self taught. Tim is a horrible professor. His lectures are uninformative and unengaging. He has absolutely no passion for the material. Avoid Tim if you aren't naturally good at stats. Lectures are vague and not engaging. Midterms are very different from assignments and did not reflect competency. His lectures are almost useless, regurgitates textbook information. Complains too much about the lecture slides that he didnt write. He seemed very unenthusiastic about the course and the material in general, and for better or worse is very blunt when replying to students during synchronous lectures. The online delivery of this class was absolutely brutal. The lecture slides are from the textbook manufacturer and he constantly complains about them. - Boring, unenthusiastic, and uninspired. - Doesn't know how to help. - Fully reliant on the textbook. - Skims through lecture slides and complains about wordiness when the exams are incredibly wordy. - Wouldn't allow us to review our midterm results and see what we got wrong. - Final exam extremely early compared to midterms. - Avoid him.
Self-Study Course, lectures feel more like guidelines.

I really liked Tim.. I know he has really bad ratings but I've sat in his 270 class and took his 201 class. I really liked it. The exams are honestly not that bad and he's really nice. He's really accessible too!

I thought I would never say this about a prof but Tim Swartz is an absolute waste of oxygen. Terrible class. I took this class online and the professor was very lazy and did not engage with the class at all. You need to teach yourself everything because there are no online lectures available. The assignments and midterm were straight forward but are only worth 30% of grade. Final exam worth 70% and an added penalty for wrong answers had  10% of questions that were specifically omitted from the reading. It's like he designed the course for students to fail.

The midterm is pretty easy if you do all the questions from the assignments. For the final, more than 90% questions are conceptual questions, and the wording can be a bit confusing. But there are fair anyways. Make sure read the textbook thoroughly before you go to the final.

Mr. Swartz is one of the most amazing profs at SFU. Very considerate to students, only a few assignments and all of the reading is done in the textbook which is only 700 pages. Final exam is worth 70% of the total grade and is completely multiple choice. Wrong answers are penalized. I wouldn't take his class again even though I did fairly well. Avoid if you can

For dist ed: Midterm was tricky, assignments are easy. Final can remove your midterm and be worth 80% of your grade. Final is easy in my opinion, therefore if you study for it you will get a good grade in the course. Definitely not as bad of a course as people make it out to be on here.
He is such a bad teacher. I took his distance ED class. For the final you get penalized (50 multiple choice): correct-incorrect/3. Horrible experience

Sonja is a great professor, she is very supportive and ready to accommodate students. The material is fairly easy and doesn't require too much review. I only have one complaint, the midterms were out of 13 or 15 marks, and one mistake can make the difference between an A and a B.

Sonja is by far the best professor i have ever had. She is very nice and professional. Prof Isberg is the definition of a good teacher. she genuinely gives a shit about both her students and the material she teaches them. take her class, any that she's teaching and you will do yourself a favour!
Best prof ever!

A great prof who cares about her students and the ways she delivered lecture materials were clear. 60% is a C- in her class. Iclicker questions every Monday and her exam was heavy. honestly he's not bad. i took it remote and had chegg to help with hw. his long test questions are usually the ones he covers in class. assigns alot of hw. it's hard to understand the concepts at first so i suggest watching other videos to help understand

Hands-down the worst prof, I have had in my 4 years at SFU. I took the class online, due to COVID-19. His lectures were pretty chaotic & hard to follow along, even though this was my 3rd stat course. He goes at a good pace and actually stops every so often so you have time to copy the notes and let the material sink in before moving on. is that okie

Scott is an ok teacher "is that ok" but can make concepts more confusing then they are,  get ready to just read the textbook on your own and learn. just one of the worst prof he is very lazy just google his name u will find his websites for other subjects.Just compare the note, midterm all the same I have no idea how he can ask the same note and question of stats 203 for 201 or 101 he explain very well his final very hard even if u study for it wish I dropped the course or take with other prof

Honestly if you're planing to take stats take it with William. He made the course more bearable and easy to understand. You just have to put the effort into it and do the practice problems then you are guaranteed a good mark.

Would highly recommend taking STAT 201 with William, he is by far the best prof at SFU that teaches it. On my teacher assessment I wrote, give him anything he wants, he is the future of your department. He's a really nice guy and really clear with what he expects on exams, and even gives hints and bonus to help you out! He honestly has amazing lecture slides that are easy to understand with TONS of examples for you to actually learn how to use the material! He teaches this course really well!

Michelle is a fairly good STATS professor. Her notes are very organized. She keeps class on schedule and is always available for help. She does have an accent, which bothers some folks. If you're able to self teach, this course with Rachel isn't bad. Assignment criteria was annoying and unclear and she does expect you to use identical wording from her own explanations. However she does really highlight what's important for exams, supplied review sessions for each exam, and allowed cheat sheets. Lowk she not too bad.
Received a D because I got under 50% on the final.... despite my overall grade being well above a passing 55%. Rough semester but even worse in this class

Horrible exams, grading schemes, and resources for help. Constantly makes mistakes for lecture notes/homework instructions and even exam preparations. No practice exams are given, but she still sends exam preparation instruction corrections at midnight, the night before the exam. You have to pass the final to pass the class. ClassaverageC Fall 2024

Class was a lot harder than it needed to be, lots of excess assignment questions compared to other stat profs when I spoke to a TA. If you like word memorization on top of studying and doing the coding homework assignments then this is the class for you, otherwise avoid. Exams you will be docked marks for not using the terminalogy from lectures

The professor is nice and understanding; she is willing to help you succeed if you put in the effort and go to office hours. However, wording matters. The course is not necessarily hard, but you need to use specific wordings and make sure you understand the differences between the concepts, as it can get tricky.

Barely got through this class, my two friends who took the course both failed because they failed the final despite doing well on the midterms + assignments. I rarely every understood anything new from lecture as I always went through the notes before class and Rachel would just read off the slides word for word.

You screw up one exam you're lowkey cooked buddy, she shows no mercy with curving grades and marks super hard on the homework, aka you don't you the definition she's looking for. Avoid, take it with Becky as she's a lot better. This prof will singlehandedly lower your gpa and make you feel miserable after the class

even with office hours, I can't imagine how I did so well in the class. I believe it's due to the many hours I put doing practice quizzes on my own time. But based on other student reviews and my peers I can safely say, how does she even have a job? Her in class examples alone are hard to understand, don't forget about the many mistakes on exams

Before you ask about my grade, just know that this was the class average.... Absolutely horrendous prof who doesn't care about teaching other than showing up, reading the slides then sending 1am emails either about errors on the homework she assigned or complaints of students collaborating on homework assignments. Avoid her if possible
she grades soooo unnecessarily difficult that it makes it extremely difficult to get a good grade. lectures were very confusing but explains things easier in office hours

Exams very long and grade on very specific terminology doesn't matter if you actually understand material. Lots of minor errors on the exam will add up and tank your grade very quickly. If you have the right terminology but wrong phrasing is used answer is wrong, was confusing because they don't tell you that in person. No real feedback was given.

Most people complained about her but her class was quite straight forward. The assignments were pretty much an exact replica of the type of questions on exams. I definitely recommend getting the text book and doing the practice questions there because they are much harder than exam questions so they will prepare you.

Worst prof of all time She constantly makes mistakes in lectures The content is not too bad if you read the slides and make sure you understand it. The exams didn't make sense at all (written) They're picky with word choice too The assignments are irrelevant to lectures. She fixes her mistakes at the last min. Her TAs don't do anything. Avoid her!

Professor Altman graded exams and assignments extremely hard, marks off if you don't use a specific word. On top, she never mentions anything regarding assignments or how to do them in lectures. Her Grading scheme was weird as you needed a 64% to get a C. No wonder the class average was a C with many getting C- or even failing Avoid her if possible
worst prof of my life

Avoid this prof. made a lot of mistakes in her lectures and was never sure what to answer when she was questioned. For the final exam we needed to get a 50% on the final to pass this course and if you didn't you get a Fail in the course which is horrible. The online prof is much better Gamage Perra, his class average was B- and for this it was C.

Class material was easy to understand but the prof herself was somewhat infuriating. many times she would email about some kind of correction made on the assignments or lectures like 1-2 days before the due date/exam date. midterms we were allowed a double sided sheet of paper but shes very picky about wording for the interpretations

Terrible prof often makes mistakes in her lecture slides and will get an email at like 1 am the day before an exam that she corrected. Very rude went to office hours couple times but did not explain anything and in a passive aggressive rude tone.

Dr Altman often makes mistakes in lectures, assignments and exams that are corrected at the last minute, often contributing to students' confusion. In lecture she often contradicted herself and answered students' questions with long tangents that did not answer the initial question. Learn with friends based on assignment contents and key formulas.

Gives indirect answers and is poor at explaining concepts. Made so many mistakes in slides, assignments, and exams. Marking is so harsh and takes off so many minor points which will tank your assignment grades. I never found any resources outside of class to be helpful, either. The final was pass or fail. Always let us in quite late to exams, too.
Not sure how STAT 201 has a C average final grade. So unnecessarily harsh for what?

The material was easy to grasp, but she was unapproachable and rambling. Her lectures were awkward and uninteresting. I often felt bad for people asking questions in class because she responded very rudely. She closed discussion boards and shut down questions despite claiming to encourage them. Professor Altman was uncaring and bland. Avoid.

DO NOT TAKE HER CLASS!! She always brings up an error in the homework or in her slides the night before due dates and tests. She avoids fully answering questions. She is a tough marker, and she provides very vague feedback on why the answers are wrong. She is not an engaging teacher, as everyone leaves right after taking the participation quiz.

Horrible prof. She only reads off of the slides, her classes are insanely boring, and she makes attendance mandatory, as you need a code to access the participation quizzes.  Overall, this class is so boring that everyone leaves after the participation quizzes are done.

One of the worst classes I have ever taken at SFU. Her slides are always incorrect and she can never fully answer a student's question in class and always tells them to "think about it." AVOID IF NECESSARY, she is an extremely tough marker and will not tell you what you did wrong

She was very approachable, was willing to have conversations with students and very very humble. She always made sure students understood her topics and took time out of her day to ensure this. I really enjoyed taking STAT 201 with her, given that it is a conventionally "difficult" course for students in the life sciences.
Many opportunities to get extra credit and uses questions straight from the practice exams (like 30%). You can write anything on the cheat sheet too. She's nice.

I'm gonna be fr- I did NOT deserve my B- I should've failed the course because I was so dumb and couldn't understand the course material (not math smart at all) but Becky always encouraged me and helped me as much as she could by explaining the concepts to me, and even giving out extra credit to people who simply attended lecture. TAKE HER COURSE!!

Dr. Lin is one of the best profs at SFU. Statistics is not an easy subject, but her slides and explanations make it digestible and easy to follow. If you do all the practice problems and homework and review the lectures, you are golden for the midterm and final. I attended a few of her online office hours and she is so caring, and super helpful!

Amazing professor, she clearly cares about her students a lot. She gives out lots of practice questions and makes sure you understand all of it. The exams were very fair, as some of the questions had the same format but worded differently. Would definitely take her classes again!

Dr. Lin is really caring and understanding towards her students as I once missed a quiz and she let me take it the next day. Her practice questions are very similar to exam questions so they're very fair. She gives opportunities for bonus marks and she posts lecture videos. She also responds to emails fast, usually within 10 min. Best prof ever.

i enjoyed becky's class so much. she was nice caring and even funny. she gave many opportunities for bonus marks. the exams were pretty much exactly like the practice materials. if i need to take another stats class i hope i can take it with becky.

Very caring and awesome professor. Her passion for her work is apparent and she genuinely wants all her students to do their very best. Granted, I was in a tough position when I took this class and ended up with a low grade. This WAS NOT the professors fault! She gives a lot of recourses and cheat sheets for midterms and the final! Very nice :)

Becky is the actual GOAT! She gives a lot of practice problems and are very similar to questions on the exams. Her accent is a little thick but her lecture slides are very self-explanatory. She wants to see her students succeed :)

The best prof I've had in uni so far. Accent is hard to understand, but she provides you with pre-recorded lecture videos and extra practice, which she sometimes uses as questions in the tests - this is enough to do good on the exams. Gives extra credit opportunities for in-person lectures. Allows aid sheets during exams. Very helpful and caring.

Becky is so sweet and a great prof! She made her lectures available online which was very helpful. Her tests were very fair and the practice problem sets she provided were very reflective of the exams. Don't hesitate to ask her questions during the exams as well she was very helpful at clarifying any confusions I had.

Becky is an amazing professor, you can tell she really cares about her students. Though she does have an accent making it difficult to understand at times, but the concepts are easy enough where it is not a massive issue. Make sure to do her practice problems and you will excel! (plus her daughter is also adorable!)

Do her practice problems, all of them, it will ensure a A and you will understand the concepts. She really wants you to succeed. She is very accessible by emails. Collect the bonus marks. Amazing prof.

One of the best profs I've had at SFU. She really cares and wants you to do well. Most midterm questions are straight from her practice sets, so if you review the lecture notes and do all the practice questions, you'll be fine. She also grades pretty easily on assignments and tests

Most caring prof out there. Truly wants students to succeed! She provides so many opportunities for help, gives lots of practice problems, previous midterms, a cheat sheet, etc.That being said, the content itself was hard (I'm not a math head). Took a while to grasp-- she has a heavy accent making her difficult to understand sometimes.

I don't usually bother to write reviews, but I had to for Becky since she's genuinely one of the best profs I've ever had. She cares so much for her students and that is reflected in how much effort she puts into teaching. She has clear expectations for exams and choosing in-person vs online helped tremendously. Thanks for everything, Becky!

As a newcomer to stats, Dr. Lin made the material as easy to understand as possible, with multiple opportunities for bonus marks based on participation. Quizzes online were open book, assignments were uncomplicated, and support for exams was plentiful. Super well organized! I would recommend for anyone needing a stats requirement!!
Becky is the best prof you will ever have. she is very caring and actually wants you to do well.

This is the best prof I've ever had. Becky is so sweet and cares about her class and students so much. She puts so much effort into everything and wants everyone to do well. Would 100% recomend taking stats with becky.

Becky is AMAZING. she is so nice, caring and accessible outside of class. Her grading and assignments are all clear and definitely graded fairly. You do need to put effort in but if you watch the lectures, read her announcements, and do the practice problems you will do great. The class is super resourceful, and you can do everything online too.
She is the best of all time for Stat 201. You should definitely take it with her !
LOVE HER. becky cares for her students and makes the class super easy to follow and provides recorded lectures. she is also very easy going on marking and exams are exactly like practice material.
BEST PROF IVE EVER HAD AT SFU
Becky is such a queeen! She's super insightful, helpful, and cares about her students.

Exams are identical to the assignments, she did give a 2% bonus assignment.  
Provided extra practice problems as well, she does have an accent but if u read the lecture slides and textbook you will be fine and do well.

While the notes can be dense, Dr. Lin is amazing at responding to questions and concerns outside of her office hours or through email. Her quizzes take material directly from the extra practice problems so make sure to do them. Overall pretty good prof!

Becky provided lots of practice problems and was very clear about what would be on the exams. Her exams were achievable enough to get high marks. She's very sweet too! However, during our MT2, she made SEVERAL TYPOS on the exam and didn't even give us time/marks back to compensate for this. Could have screwed up a bunch of students.

Very kind and caring professor. Answers emails very quickly and tries to help you if you have any questions. Class is difficult but exams are based on the homework and assignments she assigns to help students do better. She may be a little hard to understand but she is still a good prof.

Becky is a really great prof. She gives bonus questions to boost our grades and is always super clear about marking and what's on the tests. She also allows cheatsheets. Sometimes her explanations can be a bit tricky to pick up in lectures. I only watched the lecture videos, didn't touch the textbook or practice questions much and did very well.

Although tests r worth a lot. They very a carbon copy of the assignments. Super easy. I never used the textbook once tbh. Really nice and easily accessible. She does have a strong accent but nothing too bad. Very caring. Easy TAs esp online course, they dont care.
she is a very sweet prof and wants her students to do well. gives a lot of bonus marks for just showing up to lecture. midterm and final were very fair.

Attendance isn't mandatory however, she does pop quizzes that counts as bonus marks and also highlights what's going to be on exams so it is recommended to show up for lectures. Assignments have guides that explains exactly how answers should be like. She clearly cares for her students and listens to advice.
very very very strong accent.

Becky is a great prof. Admittedly the accent is a bit hard but after a few classes you get used to it. Attendance is not mandatory BUT there are pop quizzes so show up (free 3% boost). She is very caring and wants to see you succeed. As long as you do the homework and make sure to know what each formula means you will do amazing in the class.
GOAT

becky is the actual goat. her lectures are organized + easy to follow and she works step-by-step through examples, her assignments are very clear (she specifically states how to get full marks) and exams are exactly like the class examples, assignments and practice problems. she throws no curveballs and clearly wants to set everyone up for success!

Literally the most awesome perfect prof. Her assignments and practice midterms genuinely help so much and are so similar to her exams. Assignments are easy and the clearest grading criteria too. She actually is a blessing

For 270. I feel like her good rating on rmp is due to her likeable personality. She is not exactly what I would call a good lecturer. She zooms through material very quickly with no time for people to ask questions, and always spent too much time at the start of each lecture reviewing the previous lecture when we already did that in our own time.
This is for 270. Becky is a good professor, but she goes through the lecture material way too fast because she spends too much time on review. Her practice questions and answer key have many errors.

Class was ok. Prof allows you to bring formula sheets for exams which helps a lot. Exams are fair and prof prepares you well for them. Quizzes are easy if you do assignments. The annoying part about this class were the assignments because they involved coding (basic coding, but still annoying). DO PRACTICE EXAMS, it will 100% prepare you for test

Becky is a good prof who cares about your success. However, her strong accent makes it really hard to understand lectures and her doodles are hard to follow on the projector. The good part is, her practice midterms and finals are very helpful and oftentimes practically the same on the actual exam. Plus, you get cheat sheets. Overall good prof.

She is very clear on what you need to know for the midterm and final (gives a study guide for each). And she pretty much gives you the answers to the homework assignments. Class average was a B, don't know how people could fail her class.

I enjoyed taking this class with becky. Even though I skipped several lectures, I kept up with the slides and did well on the exams. Her exams were based on the slides and homework assignments so they were fair. She wants you to succeed. If you try in this class, you can easily get an A.

If you're ready to put in the effort, this class could easily be an A+. She makes the course easy for you to succeed. Exams are like practice Qs/midterms/assignments. First week, you get used to her accent and if you show up/put in the effort, you'll understand her with no problem. Her grading is 100% transparent. TAKE HER CLASS IF YOU CAN
Professor Becky is great. She really cares about her students, and it is easy to get a good grade if you put in the effort. Highly recommend!

Ms. Lin is someone very caring, she really wants her students to succeed in her course and if you put the work in, you will be just fine. Her lectures are very heavy tho, she talks really fast and her accent makes it even harder to understand. Do all the assignments, quizzes and DO THE PRACTICE MIDTERM + FINAL EXAM (super helpful)

Take a class with this prof given the chance - one of the best profs. Teaches in a clear manner, quizzes, midterm, and final were really fair. If you put in the effort, you can do well with this prof.

She is an amazing professor who wants you to succeed. If you don't understand something in her office hours she goes over everything. She has extra credit bonus Rstudio courses which are great practice and 1% extra. Highly recommend Dr.Lin!

Dr. Lin really wants you to succeed and it shows. She lets you bring cheat sheets to exams and is very clear on her criteria and expectation. Her lectures are difficult to understand at times, but she has everything you need to know on the slides which makes studying easy. I would definitely recommend if you're willing to work a bit.
